texts.text: Despite all my hopes and best efforts...
Finding the place Mom's sketch is depicting in a book isn't proving easy.
But I've figured out a possible hint.
Mom really loved nature.
Mountains, forests, flowers, all that stuff.
She might have drawn that sketch after seeing those things crumbling around her in Nariyama due to the pigeons.
As far as I remember, the place we three visited the most together was...
A conifer forest in Fukushima.
It's an area of private land with a forest and a lake.
That's where Mom fell out of the canoe.
I often dream about one time the car broke down on our way there.
Back then...
We were heading to that very place when she told me that she'd already picked the spot.
Her smug smile makes more sense now.
In the end, Sumomo keeps coming to the library with me every day.
She spends a lot of time reading the magazines that strike her fancy, though.
But whenever she finds an article about my mom, she always makes sure to tell me about it.
And some of what she shows me is stuff I never knew, so it's certainly a big help to have her here.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hey, Kanna, do you know this person?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Hm?
She shows me a magazine published this very month.
There on the page is a man wearing a flashy shirt.
The ARTE of LA FOTOGRAFIA is a PASION!
The headline reads in big, bold letters, making me think for a second.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Spencer Arashiyama? Of course I know him.
He's a famous photographer who appears frequently in various specialist magazines. No one knows his real age, and he speaks Spanish a lot.
His style and speech astound many, but no one can doubt his skill.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: He's probably the most famous photographer in Japan, after Mom died.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It says here that he had a good relationship with Anna and her family.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Really?! Are we talking about the same person?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Look, he talks about Anna here. Maybe he knows your daddy too?
I turn my eyes to the article Sumomo points to.
Photographers with the PASION that Anna had are far and few between.
She was simply overflowing with PASION for cars and nature.
I also had the pleasure of getting to know her FAMILIA.
Her TIMIDO and DULCE ESPOSO, as well as their little CHICO.
I shortly came to learn that her ESPOSO possessed a most CALIENTE FUEGO in his heart that rivaled even hers.
Meeting them, I learned that FUEGO in one's ALMA isn't always readily apparent.
There's Spanish mixed in the text, so I have to read it over three times, even if it's admittedly easy to understand.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You're right. It looks like he knew us.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: The 'chico' he's talking about must be you, right?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: And he had a lot of praise for your daddy.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...Yeah.
I see.
It's shouldn't be a surprise to me that Dad and Mom have friendships I'm not privy to.
Still, it kind of feels like I'm seeing a new side to them that I never knew about before.
I flip through the magazine.
Then I stop on a page that catches my attention.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh...
It's a group interview featuring Mom, Dad, that Spencer friend of theirs...
And that young man named TAKUMA.
I try to keep my expression as neutral as possible as I turn the pages.
"When I saw your FOTOGRAFIA, I felt your AMOR for nature in a strong way."
"Why, it's very close to the PASION I see in Anna's art."
He does have a pretty unique speech pattern.
I will send this young man to Yale very soon.
I feel the gulf between us growing larger and larger.
The realization that I haven't done anything as remarkable as him starts sinking in.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Sorry, I didn't notice.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's fine. Don't worry about me.
I turn the page again.
Their dialogue continues across six more pages of the magazine.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Hm?
But on the very last page...
There's an advertisement encouraging readers to send in their pictures for Spencer to critique.
I want you to thoroughly burn me with your PASION!
Or so it reads.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Are you upset again?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: No...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Let's buy a copy of this magazine on our way home.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Never mind. Let's get going.
We stop by a bookstore and pick up a copy of the magazine along with an envelope.
This magazine is published at the end of the month, so I just barely have time to send in my submission.
I don't have time to photograph anything new.
I cut off the proof of purchase from the magazine, which is necessary to apply for Spencer's critique.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh? You're not gonna read it?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Nope. People who purchase the magazine can submit photos for critique.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Huh? You're gonna do that?
When I nod, Sumomo beams.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: That's incredible! Which photos are you sending?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'm going to pick some now.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Let me choose them with you!
We choose the best of my pictures and print them out.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hm? What are you guys doing?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: He's sending his photos to a professional photographer so he can look at them.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Oh?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: He's so cool when he's proactive, isn't he?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: So a professional, huh?
Azuki picks up the magazine from the sofa and begins flipping through the pages.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: This guy? Spencer Arashiyama?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Apparently he's a friend of Kanna's parents.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: That so? Then why don't you ask your dad to show them to him?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You just don't get it! He wants to try and make it on his own first! Right?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Well, I think he might recognize the name on the letter.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: That's fine! I'm sure he'll realize you didn't wanna use your parents and acknowledge how gutsy and upfront you are!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You'll make a way better impression than by trying to use your parent's name like other people do.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Heh, you really are a cunning peach, eh?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Mmh...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh, that's Halley's Comet.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I took it at the camp.
I pick up the shot of the comet.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It's so pretty!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I wasn't really feeling much when I took it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Really?
I also pick up the picture of the sunset sky I took from inside the cave.
I was thinking of the composition of the sketch, so it kind of looks like it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: That's the one from the cave.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: If I send this...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: If he knows about the sketch, this might speak to him in some way.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Huh, makes sense.
That kind of feels like cheating, though.
These pictures will probably reach Spencer right after the comet is closest to Earth, or possibly right before.
And by then, I should have my answer about the place, regardless of what happens.
Ultimately, I can still ask Dad if I need to.
But that's my true last resort.
I can only send one picture for him to critique.
It's no wonder.
Barring stuff like contests, it's rare for an active and famous photographer to offer critique like this.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Oooh!
Azuki seems entertained by something in the magazine.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Look at this brat! He's riding an SR! That's some good taste for someone so young.
I glance her way and recognize those pages. It's the discussion between Spencer and TAKUMA.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: And it has a custom suspension system. Man, this kid is pretty cool.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Azuki!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Huh? What?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Don't read that!
Sumomo rips the magazine out of her hands.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Why not?!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Because!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Eh?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Boys are sensitive!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's fine, Sumomo.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Huh? Oh, you know him or something?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Not at all.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: But they're the same age. I get why he'd feel self-conscious about him.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Really? But you two are totally different people. Why're you getting self-conscious because of him?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You like bikes and mountains now?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You're more the indoor type, aren't you?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah, I guess.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hmm?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I don't feel self-conscious because of him. Sumomo's the one with that idea.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ouch.
In the end, I decide to send the picture of the comet I took at the camp.
I also attach a brief letter.
It was really nice to read what you had to say about my mom in that article. I'm also aiming to become a photographer like her.
I would be grateful to read your comments on this photo of the starry sky. I took it while looking for the location of a sketch my mom left behind.
Yours sincerely, Amei Kanna.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Okay.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It's ready?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah, I'll go mail it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Sure thing! Be careful out there!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: He's around that age, eh?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Right? He's totally self-conscious about that other guy.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Yup, no doubt about it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Well, I get how it feels.
I flip through the magazine's pages.
Both the young photographer Kanna is self-conscious about and the apparently super famous one are good looking, but neither of them have that special something.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I wonder why he's so worried about him. Kanna's way cooler and better looking.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Huh? You mean our Candy?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Is it kinda creepy for me to say? You know... I kind of really like Kanna, to be honest.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Eh?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Wait, what? You mean as in he's kinda nice to look at? Or as in, like, you wanna get it on?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! You a virgin or something?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I'm not a fucking virgin!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Well... I guess I would be lying if I said I'm not attracted to him in that way.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: He's just so cute. I can't get him out of my mind.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Uh... You sure that's a good idea? I mean, the age gap is kind of...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yeah, you don't need to tell me.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You like younger guys?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Nope.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I've always dated older men, never anyone younger than me. Though I guess I might've had a few one-night stands.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Uh, how many guys have you been with?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Huh? How about you?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Err, I don't think I can count them all.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! You're a crappy liar!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I bet you can count them with just one hand.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I can't! One hand's not nearly enough!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Jackpot! Ahahah, you're a treasure!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: It doesn't matter how many people I've been with!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yep, we're on the same page there.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: But then again... I wonder if Kanna thinks I'm a slut or something.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Then why the heck did you talk about that in front of him? That's not the kind of stuff you bring up in front of the guy you like.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Really?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Really!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: But I always just say whatever comes to mind.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Haah, guess dating is off the table, huh?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Heh, it's that dumbass we're talking about. Don't you think he might be a little wet behind the ears when it comes to girls?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! Maybe.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hey, Azuki.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Now what?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: How long are you planning to stay here? The car's almost fixed, right?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: And when he takes his picture of the comet, I don't think there'll be any point to us sticking around anymore.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Mmh, guess not.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: He's keeping us secret from his daddy too. I don't think we can stay much later than the end of August.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: The heat is starting to get serious in here too.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Why is Candy even living in the garage anyway? He doesn't get along with his dad?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Nah, I don't think it's that. His daddy just worries about him. He's a pretty serious guy.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: That so? We haven't even met, now that I think about it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: And we're nearing the end of July.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Being honest, I guess that's about the time we should bounce.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Right.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: So we have like one week left.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: We have one last camping trip together, right?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hm?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Let's make sure we have tons of fun with it.
It's been a week since we camped out near Nariyama.
And during that whole time, my thinking hasn't shifted.
The more I think about it, the more I'm certain this must be the place I'm looking for.
It's the place I visited with my parents the most.
The owner of the land let us camp there since he was a fan of my mom, and I never saw anyone else around.
And most of the pictures in our albums are from that place.
Not to mention the lake surrounded by conifer forests.
If this is the place, I can understand my mom's smug smile when she told me about it.
It's outside of the prefecture.
So we can't exactly walk there.
However...
Since it's in a different prefecture, I can be fairly certain that the forest is still there.
And on July 25th, the starter that Azuki ordered finally arrived.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's on!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Scrap Hunter for the win!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! What's that supposed to be? Your war cry?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Geez! Can you let me celebrate in peace?! What's your problem?!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: No way! You say that often?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: No, I don't!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! You're cuckoo, girl!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Shut it!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: This is incredible! Thank you, Azuki! Thank you so much!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Heheh.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's working! We made it in time!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: If I say it'll be fixed, fixed it'll be!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's amazing! You're amazing, Azuki!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Scrap hunter for the win?
I nod.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Scrap hunters for the win!
Azuki nods enthusiastically.

texts.name: Azuki&Kanna
texts.text: Aww yeah! Scrap hunters forever!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! You two are losing it!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: So, do we have a destination?
I nod and show them both a picture of the place.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's a private property in Fukushima. I think this should be the spot.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yeah? Why?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: The old man at the reception the last time we came camping said the ecosystem around here had collapsed and the natural state had changed.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yeah, right.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Oh, so it's about the pigeons? It's true that we get a lot of 'em around here.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I think she drew this sketch when nature around here started changing. And this is the place we visited the most after that.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: And there's a conifer forest here too.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Conifers, huh? Sounds legit.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: It doesn't sound impossible, I guess.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: So our next stop is Fukushima! How long is the trip?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Four or five hours, give or take?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Whoo, long trip! But hey, we got the car now! We're just gonna drive there, right?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Maybe I can just go to sleep in the back and we'll be there by the time I wake up?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: We can't be in the camper while the car is running. It's the backseat for us.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Gotcha. Well, it'll be fun either way.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: When are we going? You want to catch the comet on the 28th, right?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You wanna go a day or two before?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah, we should arrive two days in advance, just to be sure.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: If it turns out it isn't the right place, we can come back after staying the night and ask my dad about it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Huh? Are you sure you wanna do that?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: There's not enough time, and I'd rather not miss a once-in-76-years chance over being stubborn.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: What if it's a place that can't be reached by car?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Mmm...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: She said it's a place I know, so I'm sure we can drive there in a day of travel.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Awh yeah! Scrap hunters forever!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I see. Got it. So we leave tomorrow and either stay one night or two in a row.
I nod.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Unlike last time, this is gonna be properly in the mountains, so we have to bring all our camping equipment.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: We're going pretty far in the car this time, right? Are you sure you don't need to tell your daddy?
I ponder for a bit and then nod.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: He's not on vacation yet. I think it'll be okay if we leave and come back while he's at work.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You sure you want to hide this from him?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's fine. I'm not a kid anymore.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Really? You think so?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I'd say we've all been there. Right, Sumomo?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Right.
At 10 a.m. on July 26th, the three of us pile into my mom's Hachimaru and drive off.
I'm in the passenger seat.
It's been so long since I felt Hachimaru's motor running.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: It purrs like a kitten. And there's nothing like the shudder you get from a diesel engine.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Ain't it nice, Candy? I bet you could get hooked on this.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yahoo! Fukushima, here we cooome!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Why the heck don't you have a license, Peach?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Huh? I never really needed one? I always had someone to drive me around.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: What the?! I can't believe you let a bunch of men turn you into a backseat potato!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I don't care, I put my efforts elsewhere. It takes work to look like the kinda girl suckers just wanna drive around, you know?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Yeah, I get it, you huge slut.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Good, you granny.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Who're you calling a granny?!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Eyes on the road, please.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! It's almost time! I hope we find the place in the sketch.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: We won't know till we're there.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'm just saying it's nice to be here, all three of us, searching for something together.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Right, Kanna?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Huh? Sure.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You want to take your pictures in that place for Anna, right? It's more about the journey, I'd say.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Granny Azuki really has no tact at all. She doesn't take her baths either.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I've been bathing every day lately! And I smell like the pretty, feminine flower I am! I even use soap!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Right, Candy? Ain't that right?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Err, yeah. You also smell like cigarettes, though.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: It's the scent of a real woman!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah, uh, whatever...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hey, guys, can't we play, like, music? You know, something for the ride.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: There should be some cassettes somewhere.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Cassettes?! I've never seen those in real life! They work?! That's crazy!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: This is so fun! It's like the car's our own private bubble!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You finally see the light! This is what I've been talking about!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Get yourself a license, girl. Cars are hecking fun.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It might be fun if I could drive a retro car like this, yeah.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Who used to drive when your mom was alive?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Dad, most of the time. Mom was usually in the passenger seat, or the back seat.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Oh, so she didn't drive? I had her pegged as the type that couldn't hand others the wheel.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: She drove herself when she was out working on her own, but it was mostly my dad driving every time we went out all together.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: So your pa likes cars, then?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Probably.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You were raised by two car enthusiasts yet you're not into them yourself?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I guess. I like riding in them, though.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I know the feel. Sometimes it's nice just being driven around.
We drive on down the highway, stopping once at a rest area, and make it to Fukushima before sundown.
We drive through the rural landscape for a while. It kind of reminds of Nariyama City.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: We almost there?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah. Go left at the next turn.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Aye, sir.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Ah, it's here. At least I think it is.
I vaguely remember this mountain trail and the private house just off to the side of it.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Wait here. I'll go say hi.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Roger that.
The married couple that owns the land still remember me.
It's actually the first time I've seen them since my mom's passing.
After some small talk, I ask them for permission to stay on the mountain for a day or two.
The couple gleefully welcome me and give me a bunch of edible wild plants from the mountains and a bottle of sake from their home brewery.
They tell me it's because "both of them loved our sake." I figure they're talking about Mom and Dad. They probably expect me to be traveling with him.
I nod, thank them for the hospitality, and go back to the car.
I didn't lie to them. I simply chose what information to divulge.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: What's that?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Booze?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Sake. And they gave us some wild vegetables, too.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Oooh!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: We're in heaven!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You can say that again! I've half a mind to build my next hideout around these parts.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I don't think they'd be too happy about that.
After we enter the mountain's dirt road, Azuki slows down Hachimaru.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: How far are we going?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Just a bit further ahead. There's a river where the road opens up, so we always parked near that.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: A river, gotcha.
We park the car near our watering spot and lose no time in putting up the tent.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Is it just me or does this place seem much rougher than the last?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: This is real camping now. Last time was baby's first outing.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: For real? I think I like baby camping.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Those who don't work won't get any sake later.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Can't you see I'm working?! Didn't you see me hammering this stake thingie down?!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Why did you come wearing those clothes anyway? We're in the middle of the mountain, not a damn runway.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I decided to make up for all those teacher training days looking like crap by dressing as fashionably as I want.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You had enough of that dumpy little suit, eh?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'd rather have a hard time moving then look like a lame-o. It's my choice!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'll go get some water.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You handle yourself well, Candy. Glad to see one of you's an experienced camper.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Candy, you gotta look for your spot, right? Get going before it gets dark.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Uh, but we still gotta—

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Worry not. We're done with the big stuff. We fixed the car and drove all the way here for you. Don't fumble it now.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...Thanks.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You go with him, Peach. I wanna smoke.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yippee! I'm coming!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Take your time.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Are you looking for some kind of landmark?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Not really. I don't really know my way around here that well.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Mmh, the trees do look kind of strange.
We walk through the conifer forest, but I keep my eyes up on the sky.
The sun wanes before long.
The comet comes into view as the sky darkens.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: This is a really nice place, I gotta say.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah, I like it too.
Walking through the forest brings back memories.
Memories of me and Mom exploring these woods together.
I haven't felt the excitement I used to feel back then in a long while.
Maybe that emotion is the reason my mom loved nature so much.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'm, like, really happy.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Hm?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You have a lot of memories with your Mom here, right?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It's nice to be here, knowing it means so much to you. Plus the air is clean, and it's quiet.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...Yeah.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Makes me feel really glad to be here, even if it's just for a short while.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...Isn't it kinda like this?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hm?
Staring up at the sky, I superimpose the sketch over the view.
The tall conifers form a rough circle with Halley's Comet in the middle.
It's very similar.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh, is this the place?!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I don't know.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Why not take a picture?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Good idea.
I attach the wide-angle lens to my SLR camera.
It's the same kind of lens that TAKUMA guy uses.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh, this is so exciting!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I took it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Show me! Come on!
I show her the picture on the camera display.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oooh! It's just like the sketch!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...Yeah.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: So this is it? This is the picture you wanted to take, right?
I tilt my head to the side slightly.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Honestly?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'm not really feeling much.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: How about we wait until it's a little darker? We can't even see the stars yet.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah, right.
Somehow I don't think that's the problem.
This is...
Just not what I want to photograph.
Together, we wait for night to fall, listening to the sounds of nature and breathing in the clean air.
What did I come here looking for?
I had Azuki fix the car and drive me here, and I had Sumomo help me find this place.
And in the end...
Is it just going to end with me taking this picture and feeling empty?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Take a look at that!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Hm?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It's so pretty.
I follow her gaze.
A blanket of stars twinkle in the sky like a box of gemstones.
And in the center, like a crown jewel, Halley's Comet arcing through the sky.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'm so happy to be here! I never knew the night sky could look this pretty!
Instead of the night sky, I find myself staring at her instead.
The way the moonlight illuminates her rosy cheeks.
I point my camera toward Sumomo's profile.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ah, you took a picture of me?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...Yeah.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Did I look cute?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You always do.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oooh, I like it when the proactive Kanna comes out to play.
This time, I aim my camera up at the sky.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Did you get a good picture?
I bring up the picture on the display. It looks just like the sketch's composition.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: This is it! It's beautiful!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Nah...
Then I display the photo I captured of Sumomo looking up at the sky.
It's the figure of an angel waiting for the night, and of her eyes sparkling at the sheer beauty of the sky above her.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...Why did I never notice something so obvious?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Your picture is far more beautiful...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: More beautiful than Halley's Comet.
I feel the touch of something soft on my forehead as I look down at the screen, but the next instant it's gone.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Huh?
When I raise my head, I see Sumomo smiling at me with an enraptured expression on her face.
She's blushing slightly.
I've never seen her like this before.
Her smile reminds me that she's a much more mature woman than she usually lets on.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: That's to thank you for saying the most beautiful thing I've heard in my whole life.
I point my camera at her again to capture this new smile.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah, there you go again.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah.
Now her smile has a tinge of embarrassment to it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! Stop it, geez!
Her expressions change so fast.
And I keep taking pictures for each new one.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Don't get too ahead of yourself.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: That's the only kiss you're getting, for now at least.
What did she just say?
Now I realize what it was I felt on my forehead.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Oh, there you are. Did you get your picture?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Well, come on and show it to me.
I show her the picture of Halley's Comet I took in the little clearing.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Oh, this is pretty good. So this is the place?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I don't know.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I don't know, and that's okay.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I finally realized what it is I really wanted to photograph.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Eh?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: His ears are dry, I checked.
Azuki gasps for some reason.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Don't tell me you...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Of course not. What do you take me for?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Right, I know.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Uh, what are you guys talking about?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Never you mind. Now let's drink that sake you got!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Count me in!
I toast with soda, and the two of them with sake.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Man, it sure is cooler around here.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I know! The sake is delicious too. This rocks!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I really wanna thank you two.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Azuki, you fixed my car like you promised, and Sumomo, you helped me all those days in the library.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Don't forget I drove us all the way here too.
I smile and nod.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: If I was alone, I probably would've found myself crushed under the weight of it all.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'm sorry I couldn't take a picture of the comet that'd capture people's hearts in the same way Mom's would have.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Really?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I think your photo's plenty pretty.
I shake my head.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I can tell the difference. I know Mom would've taken a way different picture.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: But...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: This time...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I realized that the journey of getting here was more important than the destination.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: And I learned more than just that.
Both of you became my friends.
At least, that's what I want to say, but I can't find the courage to voice it out loud.
I'm too embarrassed.
I can tell them another time.
Because I'm certain.
No matter how much time passes while we're apart, I'll meet with them again.
I just know it.
I notice both of their smiles widening as I trail off.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Well, if you're happy, then that's all there is to it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yep, that's it! We're just happy you brought us along for a fun camping trip.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I don't think you two could've hauled all that camping equipment in and out of the car on your own.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: So, are are going to stay two night? Or go back tomorrow?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Either is fine by me. But it was a long trip to get here, so we might as well enjoy it a little longer.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Huh? You really gonna let the 28th just pass by? Isn't it a big day for you?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: For my mom, yeah. I already took the picture of the comet that I wanted to take.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: And I had my realization while I was taking it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Then we might as well leave tomorrow.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Yeah, I'd say one day is more than enough. Need to get back and take a proper bath.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'm sure you could live without one.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I doubt you could, though.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I guess I could rinse my hair in the river, at the very least. I did bring my stuff.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You'd do that? Maybe you're more suited to the great outdoors than you think.
We roast the food we brought and enjoy a long, relaxing dinner.
Time slips by peacefully.
Azuki and Sumomo have a blast drinking.
Watching them both, I realize that people get drunk differently depending on how they drink.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hey, Candy. What's the thing you want to photograph?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Huh?
Azuki directs a question my way as she eats the cooked vegetables and noodles we prepared.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You said you realized what you want to photograph, remember?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I wanna know too!
Both of them turn to me, their eyes inquisitive.
I look down at the cup in my hands.
I watch the leftover orange juice at the bottom sloshing around.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: People, I guess.

texts.name: Sumomo&Azuki
texts.text: People?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You said it before, Azuki.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I don't like cars and bikes in the same way you do.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: And I don't have a lick of fashion sense, like Sumomo does.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: In the same way...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'm a different person than my mom.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I kind of realized I can't drive the car around like she did and take beautiful pictures of the stars like her. It's just not me.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I see now.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: But...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I did have fun taking pictures of Sumomo.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: When I saw her expressions react to what I said, I felt something I never had before.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: For the first time, I felt that I was actually taking good pictures.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: So...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I figure maybe what I really wanna photograph is people.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hold that thought for a second, now...

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hasn't it occurred to you that maybe it's not that you like photographing people, but Peach specifically?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Simply put, doesn't that basically mean you like her?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Really?!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: No, uh, I...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I haven't photographed anyone besides her, so I don't really know.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Why not just come out and say you like her already, boyo?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: No, hold up, I kinda like whatever this is.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Well...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Well?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I do think she might, uh, mean something to me.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Oh boy. Why am I even here?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! If we trace it back, you came to steal the car, right?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Slander! He's the one who asked me to come look at it first!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Oh, I did that, huh?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Whoa, it's been a hot minute...
I remember the day I sent the letter to Azuki, asking that mysterious mechanic to come take a look at the car.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It hasn't even been three weeks since then.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: For real?! It feels like we've been together for three months.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Word.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Have you two thought about what to do after this?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: After?
I nod.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You're gonna go somewhere else when summer ends, right?
Both of them exchange glances.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I suppose so, yeah. It's not like we can stay in the garage forever.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Where will you go, Azuki?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I dunno. But it's gotta be a place where the roads are wide, so nowhere near Tokyo.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Maybe I'll follow you around for a while.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Huh? Don't you have stuff to do? I mean, you're a college student, right?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yeah, but I kinda wanna spend my time doing what I wanna do.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: If I stick with you and visit lots of different places, maybe I'll find something.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Fat chance, I reckon.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Huh? Really?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah, why not?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You gotta sit down and think until you find it. I know you hate doing nothing, but that's the only way. You've gotta ask yourself.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You only go and look outside after taking a long, hard look at yourself. It's the kind of stuff you can only find the answer to inside of you.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: It has nothing to do with where you are.
Sumomo stares at Azuki in disbelief.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Azuki, you...

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hm?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You can totally tell you're in your thirties.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I'm gonna throw you in the river!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! Relax, it's a compliment! I mean it in a good way!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You're not going back to college? What about your teaching license? Aren't you going to qualify?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Mmh, I don't know, but I don't think I'll need it anyway.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Really?
With the same pleasant smile gracing her face, she nods. Then she takes a sip of sake and heaves a huge sigh of satisfaction.
I wonder if alcohol tastes as good as they make it seem.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You're the one who helped me realize that, you know?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I did?!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Remember that photo you gave me? The one of me in Terminal 1?
I nod.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I really love that picture.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Seeing myself all happy and smiling in it made me realize that I just wanna be who I really am.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: And I think my mom would prefer to see me like that too.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I know she just wants me to be happy.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Right.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: What I'm trying to say is that, thanks to you taking my picture, I discovered something inside of myself.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I realized something important, all thanks to your photo.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You're already changing people's lives with them!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: And that's incredible! It's why I'm certain you'll become a great photographer.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Do your best. I'll always be cheering you on.
Suddenly, her smile looks a little more desolate.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: The hell do you guys think you're doing, getting all sappy on me?! I'm kind of feeling like a third wheel here, if I do say so myself!
I wash the dishes we used yesterday and hand them to Sumomo.
She thoroughly wipes each one dry with a towel and puts them back in their box.
While we're doing that, Azuki dismantles the tent in no time.
Morning up in the mountains is fresh and cool, and the air is as clean as ever.
The blue sky spreads above us and the sun shines brightly.
We pack up quickly with the cicadas cries as our soundtrack.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: All done. You sure we're good to go back?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah, it's fine.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Okay, then.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You sure you didn't drink too much yesterday? You gonna be okay?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I never get hangovers!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh, so you're one of those people who just goes wild for the night.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I don't get drunk in the first place, you damn nag.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: So she says, Kanna.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: She wasn't that bad last night. I'm sure it'll be fine.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You wanna go say goodbye on our way out, right?
I nod.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Make sure to thank them for the sake, okay? It was sooo good!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah.
After thanking the old couple, we leave the mountain behind.
Once we've driven through the countryside and arrived back on the highway, Sumomo falls asleep in the backseat.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: She's asleep.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Talk about shameless.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Hm?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Peach.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Oh, right.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I'd say a woman like Peach is perfect for a sweet, quiet guy like you.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...She doesn't see me that way.
With her hands still firmly on the wheel, she glances at me for a second then sighs.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You still have a ways to go, Candy.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What?
The road back to Chiba was actually a little more congested than on the way to Fukushima.
Thankfully, though, we arrive back at the garage before night falls.
During the week, Dad gets home pretty late.
This way he won't notice the car was ever gone.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Can I take a bath already? I wanna drop dead.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Go right ahead. I'm off to bed.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: What? But you didn't take a bath yesterday! How can you sleep with yourself?!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: It's a survival skill, that's all.
I yawn as I listen to them yapping at each other as usual.
Azuki's right. The trip was so tiring I could fall asleep on my feet.
But when I turn my drowsy eyes to the little wooden table...
What I see there wakes me right up.
Come to the house when you get back.
Never before has a note made me so nervous.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Why did he come in here?
No, that's not the problem right now.
He must have come into the garage while we weren't here, which means...
He would have noticed Hachimaru was gone.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh? What's wrong, Kanna? Are you tired?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It looks like Dad dropped by.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: While we were away? Why?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I don't know. But he must have seen that Hachimaru was gone.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: That's bad, right?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: What did you tell him?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I told him some friends were gonna be staying, and asked him to stay out.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Friends? Like, from the academy?
All three of us are silent for a moment, before Sumomo speaks up.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Want us to go in with you?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: No.
That would just make it more complicated.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'll explain things to him. You two wait here.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Are you sure? It won't end up in a fight like last time?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I don't know.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: But I have to try.
My mind races as I try to figure out what to tell him.
How do I even begin to explain?
Do I tell him someone got sick and we had to rush them to hospital in the car?
No, they're supposed to be friends from the academy. He'd ask who was driving.
Maybe a brother or a sister of one of my friends?
Or their parents?
Any answer I can think of is convoluted at best.
I guess I just need to come clean.
Bracing myself, I open the front door and step inside.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Huh?
I see my dad sitting at the table.
When he notices me, his expression hardens.
He's angry.
It's plain to see.
And sitting in front of my dad...
There's a man I recognize right away.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Where have you been?

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: Whoa, you've grown! You look just like Anna. How lindo.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Stay out of this, would you?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Spencer Arashiyama? What are you doing here?

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: You sent me your foto, right? It got me nostalgico, you see. So I came by to reminiscence.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: We can talk about that later. Kanna, you fixed the car? Don't tell me you've been driving without a license.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I haven't. I had my friend who has a license do the driving.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: So those friends you told me about aren't from the academy?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Er, well...
I stumble on my words and look down at my feet.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: No, they're not.
He lets out a huge sigh.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: I thought you said were going to dedicate yourself to photography this summer? What have you been doing back there?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It was all for that. I can explain.
I tell him how Azuki stayed over to repair Hachimaru.
And how my teacher finished her training and is now staying as well.
I also tell him that we all went out in the car together to photograph Halley's Comet.
I decide not to mention how Azuki stole the car, and I burned down her bus by trying to drive without a license.
I kind of twist the story into Sumomo introducing her mechanic friend to me after seeing that Hachimaru wasn't working.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: So that teacher in training, huh?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: But I went back to the academy thanks to her. She did all that for me.

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: Remarkable. This is truly excelente, Take.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Be quiet. This is an issue between father and son.

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: Not quite. Just a minute ago, you were practically begging me to listen to what your chico has to say, remember?

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: The situation has changed.
He did what?
He wanted him to listen to what his chico has to say?
Chico?
Uhhh...
Oh, right, it means "son." That's me.

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: It hasn't changed at all. The pasion of this chico here to snap a picture of the comet managed to gain him the support of two more amigos.

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: Truly, you are Anna's chico. I read your carta.

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: Let me ask you one thing. Think hard, and try to be as honesto as you can in your answer.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Okay.

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: The foto you sent. Was that your best one?
Slowly, I shake my head.

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: Okey. Then we can keep talking. Are you able to prepare your best foto for me right now?

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: If you can, I'll take a look at it. It's the least I can do after this grumpy old hombre here practically prostrated himself before me on your behalf.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: I see you're still prone to running your mouth.

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: Foto en mano vale mas que cien volando, my friend.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: I have no idea what you're saying.
Spencer turns to me after having a chuckle at my dad's expense.

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: So? Will you show me your most preciosa piece?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Y-Yes!

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: Go on then, ahora mismo. Get to it.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I-I'll be back right away!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Oh? Back so soon?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Was he mad?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I-I'll explain later! Give me a moment!
In a rush, I grab the photo of Sumomo I printed for myself.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Huh? Is that my picture? What are you doing? Are you showing that to your daddy right now? Why?!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Spencer Arashiyama's here!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Who?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Th-The photographer?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: He asked me to show him my best photo, so I'm showing him this!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: What is even happening anymore? Is this real life?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Who's this Spencer Arashiyama guy? His name sucks.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: So does yours.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: H-Here it is.

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: Hm...
Spencer stares at the photo for what feels like a lifetime.

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: Chico.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yes?
That must be me.

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: Not bad. Not bad at all.

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: To be honesto, I came here after looking at the foto you sent to tell you that perhaps you should give up on becoming a fotografo.

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: There was nothing of worth in the one you sent. So if that was the very best you could offer, bueno...

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: You wouldn't amount to much more than simply being Anna's chico.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I know...
He's right.
I'm the one who got myself into that situation.

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: It made me feel a poquito sorry for you, so I came to tell you to your face. For the sake of the good amistad I share with your parents.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...Right.

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: But...

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: You are hopelessly in love with this chica here, aren't you? I can see it as clear as day in this foto.

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: Why do you point your camera to the cielos when you have such a magnificent subject? You should be photographing people.

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: We're same, you and I. Personas rather than things.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Does he show promise?

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: Sadly for you, he does. He has talento, or at least a measure of it.
I have talent?
I can feel my heart beating faster.
I'm so happy.
My photo's been recognized by a photographer on the same level as mom was.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Don't praise him too much, it'll go to his head.

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: You've become a proper papi. Truly, Anna was always right putting her trust in you.

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: Chico.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Y-Yes?

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: Would you like to come and be my asistente? If you get a firsthand look at how a pro photographer works, no doubt you'll improve quickly.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Y-Yes! I'd love to!

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Hey, he's still a student.

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: Then how about just the fin de semana? Weekends should be fine.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Dad, can I?
After closing his eyes in silence for a long moment, he sighs deeply.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: You'll go to class on weekdays. And I don't want to see your grades drop any further.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I promise.

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: Now, I'll issue some homework for you.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Homework?

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: I'm sure as Anna's chico, you are well aware of what day tomorrow is.
I nod.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: The day Halley's Comet is the closest to Earth. It only happens once every 76 years.

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: Exactamente! So you will photograph it.

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: El jubilo on the faces of the people looking up at it, that is.

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: The most wonderful thing about the estrellas isn't their own brilliance, but that of the people looking up at the sky.

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: If their sparkle alone was enough, fluorescent lights would do the job.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'll do it.

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: Buena suerte.
He stands up as he wishes me luck.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: I'm sorry for taking up your time like this.

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: Why, it's nothing. I can't say I had a bad time. After all, I got an excellent estudiante out of it.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: He's in your hands.

texts.name: Spencer Arashiyama
texts.text: Leave it to me. He's yours and Anna's chico. I'll whip him into shape with as much amor as though he were my own.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: That's good to hear.
My new teacher boards the taxi waiting for him in front of the house and leaves. I suppose I didn't notice it in my hurry.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You asked him to come?

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Hm?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Spencer, I mean.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: I know next to nothing about photography. After being with Anna for so long, I know how useless the opinion of an amateur is.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I thought you were against it.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: If I don't support your dream, Anna will never let me hear the end of it when we meet again.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: But this doesn't mean that I'm giving you permission to do whatever you want. Got it?
I nod.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Let me go say hello to your teacher. She's been looking after you, right? Is she in the garage right now?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Uh, err, yeah, but...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Kanna!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Did you get yelled at?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: *Gasp*!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Eep!

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Oh? Where's your teacher?
I glance over at my dad.
I realize he never really met this Sumomo. He only saw her in that suit and wig.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Um, it's me. It's been a while.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Huh? That was you? You're the one who came to our house that time?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yes, I-I...
Sumomo quickly goes to her bag and plucks the wig out of it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: See?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah, I'm sorry to intrude in your home.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Oh, don't be. I hear you've helped my son a great deal. Your friend is a mechanic, from what I hear?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Eh?! Uh, yes... Though I prefer the term scrap hunter... Actually, yeah, mechanic is fine.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: You managed to get the car working?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Yeah. I changed the starter and replaced the parts that were wearing out.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Did you now?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: ...Yes, Sir.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Kanna, you three have been sleeping out here?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: No, uh... Yeah.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: They sleep on the sofa and me in a sleeping bag.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: It was rude of you to make them stay out here like that. I'm very sorry. It can't have been comfortable.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh, no, it's nothing! We're the ones who insisted on staying because we had no place to live. Kanna was nice enough to help us out. Right, Azuki?!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Eh? Y-Yeah, right.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: That's right. Candy was nice enough to lend us the place.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Candy?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Um, we're leaving now, anyway.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Today?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Why?!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Well, we've done what we set out to do. We were already planning to leave today.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You didn't tell me anything about that.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: It's late. If you'd like, please feel free to stay another night. Kanna, you go sleep in your own room, okay?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...Okay.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: I'll be back in the house.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Okay.
Dad bows to Azuki and Sumomo then returns to the house.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Guess the jig is up.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: It's a miracle we weren't thrown out onto the street for trespassing, so I'd say we came out on top.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I think so too. Your daddy's a really kind man, Kanna.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What are you two gonna do now?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Good question. I knew I couldn't live here forever, but I haven't really figured anything else out.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Maybe going back to Tokyo would be the right choice.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: And you, Azuki?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I'll manage, one way or another. You worry about yourself, sweetie.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh, right! What happened with that Spencer guy?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I showed him your picture.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: And?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: He said I'm not bad and asked me to come work as his assistant. Only during weekends, though.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: For real?! That's amazing! You did it! We should celebrate!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: So this Spencer guy or whatever. Is he, like, good?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: He's the most famous photographer in Japan. He has to be good.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: He even appeared in that magazine!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Mhm. Good for you.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah, but...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You don't even have a way to get around yet, do you, Azuki? I'll ask my dad to let you stay for longer.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: That'd be nice, but...
Both of them stay silent for a moment.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Kanna, your daddy was really considerate to us just now. We can't just do that to him.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It'd be really stressful for everyone if he ended up being forced to tell us to leave, so we have to go on our own. We gotta be responsible adults for once.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Way to pick a time to be responsible after staying in someone's garage without permission for weeks.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: We're in the same boat, dummy.
These two...
They're pulling the adult card now?
It feels like they're just using it an excuse to decide everything without me.
It makes me feel so frustrated.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: But why? Weren't we having fun together? You can still stay. I'm the only one using the garage anyway.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Candy, you know as well as we do. We just can't.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Your pa owns this place, remember? Eventually he's gonna tell us we have to leave, and that'll be his right.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: But...

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Thanks for everything, sweetie.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yeah, I'll never forget the time we spent together.
Both of them smile at me.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Why are you guys ending it like this?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: We were just getting into a groove.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: We can go visit tons more places in August.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Hachimaru's working again and all.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Kanna, let's have a final photo session tomorrow.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Something to remember all the good clean fun we've had together these last few weeks.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Let's have fun... all the way to the end.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Okay?
Sumomo comes closer and gently strokes my head.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: And then we can all watch Halley's Comet together. You can call your daddy to join us too.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Why would I ask him to join?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I want to say goodbye properly and thank him for letting us stay.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: And it'll take even more time for you two to make up if you pull away from him again now.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'm sure Anna would've loved to see the comet with her family. And I'm sure she'll be smiling down on you two from Heaven if you spend it together.
I feel like what she's saying is right.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Yeah, a bird doesn't shit up the nest when it's about to leave. And we scrap hunters are like birds, flying from place to place.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! I bet that sounded cooler in your head!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I'm not lame, for the love of God!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...I'll tell Dad.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Okay. We still have some sake left over from the last camp, so tell him we can drink that together. I'll put it in the fridge.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Okay.
I leave the garage, and the two of them, behind.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Aww, we got busted. We did something bad, huh?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: To who?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: To Kanna and his daddy.
Flopping down onto the sofa, I stare up at the ceiling.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: What are we gonna do now?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: What d'you mean? We gotta leave. There's no way around that.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yeah, but Kanna looked really down.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: He wasn't even going to class before we came around. You think he'll be okay?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hang on, I thought you were done with the whole teaching thing?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'm not saying it as his teacher! I'm worried because I like him.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Will things get worse between him and his dad? Will it be my fault again?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: His dad seems like a good guy. I mean, he raised that little guy well.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: He sure did. Kanna's really fortunate.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hopefully he realizes that himself soon.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: *Sigh*
Summer memories flash before my eyes.
None of them are memories from before I came to the garage, and that makes me realize...
I really had a lot of fun here, huh?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I wonder if Kanna will remember the time we spent together fondly.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Whoa, you're way more pure-hearted than I thought.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I told you, I'm a genuine pretty gal. Though I'm just a pretty gal.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: How about just telling him already? Might as well hit on him, while you're at it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: That's a crime! Think of poor little Kanna. He'd have a heart attack.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Come on, make your move. No one will know.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You think so?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Go for it, girl!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: ...Guess I might just do that.
When I enter the living room, I see Dad washing dishes in the kitchen.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Dad.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: What is it?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: About tomorrow night...
He looks up at me.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Sumomo asked if you'd like to watch the comet with us from the garage.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Sumomo?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: The teacher. She said she wanted to say a proper goodbye before leaving.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: I see. All right.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: But you got an assignment from Arashiyama, didn't you? Don't you need to go out to take photographs?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'll go take some nearby. I think people will be gathering at the academy to see the comet, too, since it's got great views of the sky.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Okay. Tomorrow night, then. I'll see you there.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Also...

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Hm?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: There's something else I wanted to talk to you about.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Haah...
After speaking with Dad, I got ready for bed and headed to my room.
Even though I'm in my own room, I can't relax.
Strangely enough, I'm already used to the sweltering heat of the garage and the hard, cramped floor of the camper.
I look out the window to the garage.
I can see light shining from the skylight.
Sumomo and Azuki must still be up.
I wonder what they're talking about.
By tomorrow, they'll both be gone.
I close the window screen and lay on my bed.
The room is cold from the night breeze.
I stare at the ceiling and think about what happened today.
Dad called that man, Spencer Arashiyama, for me.
This whole time I lived in the garage, Dad was looking out for me in his own way.
The sadness I saw in his eyes the first time Sumomo came to the house flashes in my mind.
It's just as he said.
I've been such a child.
Why didn't I ever try to be honest with the person who has always cared about me?
I can't help but wonder what went through his mind after he went out of his way to call Spencer Arashiyama here and learned I invited strangers to his garage.
Disappointment, most likely.
No, perhaps sadness again.
It's no use thinking about it.
As my gaze wanders out the window, I see the comet streaking the sky.
Tomorrow will be the day the comet is closest to Earth, finally.
The last day the three of us spend together.
"You are hopelessly in love with this chica here, aren't you? I can see it as clear as day in this foto."
I recall Spencer's words, and they make me think of her.
I think of all the expressions Sumomo has shown me.
She has taught me something I feel I should have known all along.
Watching her just be herself despite everything, no matter what anyone says.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: El jubilo on people's faces, huh?
It's just like he said.
Azuki also spoke of it once.
I do love her.
